title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe an advantage of using hydroelectric power plants over coal-fired power plants, such as one of the following.
The response describes one advantage of using hydroelectric power plants over coal-fired power plants, such as one of the following.

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe a potential disadvantage of using hydroelectric power plants, such as one of the following.
The response describes one potential disadvantage of using hydroelectric power plants, such as one of the following.

title: Part (b)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not propose one of the following different renewable resources that would be a realistic solution to generating electricity without fossil fuels or hydroelectric power.
The response proposes one of the following different renewable resources that would be a realistic solution to generating electricity without fossil fuels or hydroelectric power.

title: Part (b)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response must be linked to the proposed solution in part (b)(i).
descriptions: The response does not justify the solution presented in part (b)(i) by explaining a potential advantage of using a different renewable resource to generate electricity.
The response justifies the solution presented in part (b)(i) by explaining a potential advantage of using a different renewable resource to generate electricity.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the setup.
